intro: Prismatocarpus laricinus, commonly known as the silver leaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are ovate to elliptical in shape and have a velvety texture. The flowers are borne in clusters and bloom during the rainy season, attracting various pollinators.
